metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16336 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Exiv2::Internal::PngChunk::parseTXTChunk in Exiv2 v0.26 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read) via a crafted image file, a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-10999.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16336` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exiv2 - 0.25-3.1ubuntu0.18.04.2
libexiv2-14 - 0.25-3.1ubuntu0.18.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: exiv2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.25-3.1ubuntu0.18.04.2').
